intro: Quercus horsfieldii var. longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf chestnut oak, is a deciduous tree native to China. It is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves that are typically 10–20 cm in length. The tree produces small, cup-shaped acorns that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and horticultural use.
